document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

3B703DD9590F482D9E89A0E6AE6DB968.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

A427FDE01EDE46509187B0C60126E60E.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

3097B62BC34C4846B49A8854232D035D.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide
additional detail.

CD70FEC2579244B6898CDFCE26385A3F.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is
not understood.

FE81DA5ED1D74F31BC58B08172303299.description:
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other
media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is
not understood.

39D9AF89832C4A17A65509B912CAEF72.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

1A6A233390DB47F5BC0DDB387A0F11B8.description:
Follow agreed-upon norms for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care and taking
turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

D906C5D8DAEA4F919B15C0B42EF802C8.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and
texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

E4A3065A7CBD4CD7ADD1B7B1CA4946FE.description: With prompting and support, engage in brief but regular writing and drawing tasks

C345A0C8DC2F4D08B1AE4A614EF096E6.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather
information from provided sources to answer a question.

53D533DA483A4E8B9C381B0370F013B3.description:
With prompting and support, generate questions through shared research in response to a
topic, text, or stimulus (e.g., event, photograph, video, book).

7B8C08E3EE714ACBA46514798B46F64E.description:
With prompts and support from adults, recognize that writing carries a message and should
make sense to others.

48B9DE8CF5C1422FA2D323988540C020.description: Provide a reaction to the experiences or events.

D03C2EB8C0704E47B9E68B42520EAEA7.description: Provide limited details of experiences, events, or characters.

496E085A892D4A07A28718C236E9233F.description:
Establish a situation and/or introduce characters; organize an event sequence (beginning,
middle, end).

2088AC370E654CA4B5BAE5F5B0009B4C.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate real or imagined experience
or events.

E309EB2D67DF4A86A99C36FD43F824A4.description:
Develop the topic with at least two facts or other information and examples related to the
topic, including pictures.

8BD299781BBB4483ABB13800A05174C7.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory
texts to convey ideas.

DFD1C3923E434ACC8D174C32B885902F.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces on topics or
texts (e.g., My favorite book is...).

362242D791C44AB09F8EB61BE7700670.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two
informational texts on the same topic (e.g., characters, experiences, illustrations, descriptions, or
procedures).

FD9DDEB9404045658A82F1D218E27E93.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two literary
texts on the same topic (e.g., characters, experiences, illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

4325646A7376479488659A178A3B9BC4.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

B0112B966609451887CF713F013D9AD5.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in
which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

4F37C261279E494FB8B4C57D52E16D40.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in
which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

70FE35247A224EBDAF3FE7D329B349C6.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of
each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

A4DC071578EA4D9BBB53CE1B3A246B88.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of
each in telling the story.

A01B2292DDCC457A83EE6B8FD62EEB71.description:
Recognize common types of informational texts (e.g., biographies, recipes, how-to manuals)
and identify features of print (e.g., front cover, back cover, and title page of a book).

4B2253390A3143DF93B9EFFF4DBF6910.description:
Recognize common types of literary texts (e.g., storybooks, poems) and identify features of
print (front cover, back cover, and title page of a book).

DDDF09CDB57741AF81C8BECA30666FE4.description:
With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas,
or pieces of information in a text.

FACAF784BB384F6393DB811855527CE3.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

8E40AF81BDFE4208A220AE3BEC1DE3F8.description:
With prompting and support, identify the main topic and key details of an informational text
(e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

D961BA82564E4B088E041B963A7B79F9.description:
With prompting and support, identify the central message and retell familiar literary texts,
including key details (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

CF25563D7989477D9AA9863412A05988.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in an informational
text (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

6BAC389F0E274470B0B69D6AAD071BD0.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a literary text (e.g.,
who, what, where, when, why, how).

67B3B4846A5A48B5A6CCE95F5E698AEE.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk,
march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

5EBE2D1DE4574A348A8FDDF58B2506FA.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that
are colorful).

BA56FB7E20A2417AA97727AE029BD5F1.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to
their opposites (antonyms).

869E37E1B71E45789EB6F915BFFEFC86.description:
Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the
categories represent.

D8AAEE7DAF7E4FE380F64AD140870177.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

F1286B8DEFBA4EAE9B5DB77EF3A1533B.description:
Use the most frequently occurring affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, -ing) as a clue to the meaning of an
unknown word.

E47367AFF2404BAA9C11EA030A0823EC.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a
bird and learning the verb to duck).

48954546198B468CB1AB9B5537FF0E2C.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the
meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and
content.

EB25EB0511924175B0105958209F2DD7.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

2A8AC9B81E574BC4BF882AD8E5AF9F37.description:
Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by,
with).

BCE668566AB54FD885D4DD58FEA6E7A9.description:
Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why,
how).

8BA000CCD0CE4F1096D872F389FE0333.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding -s or -es (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

5061F010C7ED4C02ABB9235B6D3147E2.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

8AA16B60A23048EC871787A242111678.description:
With prompting and support, develop knowledge of language and its conventions when
speaking and listening.

2749AB01C7004EB280E0B8CA9F60043F.description: Use conjunctions appropriately in sentences (e.g., and, but, so, and because).

CA477B460B4548D2A078D515EA4BF456.description:
Elaborate a simple subject or simple predicate, in response to questions who, what, where,
when, how, or why.

8A81625C47294B9EA74DB8819F36C6C5.description:
With support, write statements in response to questions, and questions transformed from
statements, using conventional word order.

ECA6CC3991D844F1826CF9AFBF974F51.description: With support, distinguish between a complete sentence and a sentence fragment.

84F3155C36754C05BEB985EA90E98370.description:
Match periods, question marks, and exclamation points to statements, questions,
commands, and exclamations.

359DF5B2DCFC4343B887377B5F715641.description: Supply the “who,” “is doing,” “what,” in a subject-verb-object sentence frame.

FA6685E8A0FD42F0B5CBD2416E271D22.description: Use manipulatives or digital tools to construct complete sentences.

91C2FC82C2F8464F9416AA8A04BE6CEC.description:
Capitalize the first word in a sentence, capitalize proper names, and include spaces between
words.

4EAAB3239D3442EAB06A5A6A9638088D.description: Repeat a sentence, identifying how many words are in the sentence.

C2BF915077324085A3B039502FA1BBC7.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of sentence composition.

29DCAABC23BC4809A2BB20D29AE60C1D.description: Writing initial and final consonant blends (must, slab, plump).

E30A42C29E6C45B1A56D15F3C7DD6091.description: Attempting phonetic spellings of unknown words.

979E669DA0EF4D5CB76B138638F2A8BD.description: Spelling VC (vowel-consonant) [at, in] and CVC [pet, mud] words with short vowel sounds.

75EBE22E9DCA4D0CB8B21B0B80B772E6.description:
Writing or selecting a missing initial or final consonant when spelling a CVC
(consonant-vowel-consonant) word.

6A4130265024476792B6D98C4F01AAA0.description:
Representing phonemes, first to last, in simple words, using letters with a transparent
relationship to sound (e.g., the “o” in “rope” may be spelled with a single letter, o).

62D000EF55F646D181DF709B8D06534E.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of encoding and spelling common, regular,
single-syllable words by:

FDCE716D17CF43F1AAAF5A9048FD55FF.description: Orally segment the phonemes in any single syllable, spoken word.

DB969D60F2844F1D9155B6FDA921C2B7.description: Write a common grapheme (letter or letter group) for each phoneme.

0A079DEF54B34BE09EF3BFEE7476097F.description:
Identify the letters used to represent vowel phonemes and those used to represent
consonants, knowing that every syllable has a vowel.

BD26501FC27F427A8BEE3682F7353EF7.description: Write left to right and include a space between words.

FF15196E5F724510B2A3800B0F291D7E.description: Write upper and lowercase letters, with reference to a model.

949A5527200242DDAD48928177038558.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of writing.

2DEF7E8B5FAF4373A78D8D55068615BE.description:
Read emergent-reader texts (decodable texts, including words with one-to-one letter-sound
correspondences) orally with sufficient decoding accuracy to support comprehension.

FE74CD6916924341A9B676DC4643A8A6.description:
Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that
differ (e.g., nap and tap; cat and cot).

681B315475564FDBBF82C1012FD50111.description: Recognize the parts of high-frequency words that are regular and the parts that are irregular.

F9946B0D000246C590FF2B217D82C9E4.description: Read high-frequency words and grade level irregular words with automaticity.

C4CB3754ECBD4ACCA4FD8962B297F534.description:
Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five
major vowels.

A320775E8A794C8AB7771D91EB76E630.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing
many of the most frequently used sounds of each consonant.

8EF05DAFAE664179A5789062C91E6E58.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding and encoding words.

B92093A958C745DE9949625019F8B28F.description:
Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new
words.

BEB818C9AB814A698C8EC64A3F0AB81B.description:
isolate and pronounce the initial, final, and medial sounds (phonemes) in spoken,
single-syllable words, (simple syllables that do not include final /l/, /m/, /r/, or /x/ sounds
and consonant blends).

6555FAF08863417C9906CB153B62A0B3.description: Orally repeat multi-syllable words and pronounce the separate syllables.

48567021C7244069BBFD8A3E19066732.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

AE4C134B57544A9CBA4B3FF345BABEA1.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

579038BDD5924E3A81791E95829F7A25.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

A687FAA18D144B86830C82815F3CEE6F.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

9CC9EA9963804CDA92B22FEB25DA2F9A.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

C6BC81032313445DAD2DB6C86D7995B8.description:
Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of
letters.

0D6D7C2A2C334BA8AC93F672BD73716A.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

D4BA7FC176D64B0FBA1D40A362C4F4A7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
